text: i love BS4 id be happy to contribute

I was working on doing that conversion in the grid-feature branch, I was doing all the grid stuff in crank_grid.css

There are no rules, don’t worry about stepping on my toes or anything. Use that branch or your own.

Work on what you want to work on, we’re not verbatim copying everything from bootstrap but we thought their grid was a good thing to use for familiarity, and the fact bootstrap is well battle-tested.

My thought process on it was I was taking the scss files from bootstrap 4 for the grid and trying re-create them basically in HubL to make it flexible like bootstrap is.

Example, if there are a bunch of numbered classes, there’s no reason we can’t just use a `{% for column in columns %}` type thing to generate the classes and CSS.

topic:
CrankShaft is an Open Source Framework for building modern websites on HubSpot. Still in it’s infancy pitch your ideas!
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft>
